questions.title: Indicators of possible depressed, anxious, or sad mood
questions.subtitle: Expressions, incl. non-verbal, of what appear unrealistic fears
questions.description: E.g. fear of being abandoned, being let alone, being with others, intense fear of specific objects or situations

responses.title: Present but not exhibited in last 3 days
Discharge assessment, covers last 3 days of service
Other
responses.description: E.g. research

questions.title: Postal / ZIP code of usual living arrangement
Residential / living status at time of assessment

responses.title: Mental health residence
responses.description: E.g. psychiatric group home

responses.title: Group home for persons with physical disability
Setting for persons with intellectual disability

questions.title: As compared to 90 days ago (or since last assessment), person now lives with someone new
questions.description: E.g. moved in with another person, other moved in

questions.title: Person of relative feels that the person would be better off living elsewhere

responses.title: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

questions.title: Residential history over last 5 years
questions.description: Code for all settings person lived in during 5 years prior to date case opened

responses.title: Long-term care facility
responses.description: E.g. nursing home

responses.title: Mental health residence
responses.description: E.g. psychiatric group home

responses.title: Setting for persons with intellectual disability

questions.title: Cognitive skills for daily decision making
questions.description: Making decisions regarding tasks of daily life

responses.title: Modified independence
responses.description: Some difficulty in new situations only

responses.title: Minimally impaired
responses.description: In specific recurring situations, decisions become poor or unsafe; supervision necessary at those times

responses.title: Moderately impaired
responses.description: Decisions consistently poor or unsafe; supervision required at all times

responses.title: Severely impaired
responses.description: Never or rarely makes decisions

responses.title: Short-term memory OK
responses.description: Seems / appears to recall after 5 minutes

responses.title: Procedural memory OK
responses.description: Can perform all or almost all steps in a multitask sequence without cues

responses.title: Situational memor OK
responses.description: Both: recognizes caregivers names / faces frequently encountered AND knows location of places regularly visited

responses.title: Easily distracted
responses.description: E.g. episodes of difficulty paying attention; gets sidetracked

responses.title: Episodes of disorganized speech
responses.description: E.g. speech is nonsensical, irrelevant, or rambling from subject to subject, loses train of thought

responses.title: Mental function varies over the course of the day
responses.description: E.g. sometimes better, sometimes worse

questions.title: Acute change in mental status from person's usual functioning
questions.description: E.g. restlessness, lethargy, difficult to arouse, altered environmental perception

questions.title: Change in decision making as compared to 90 days ago (or since last assessment)
Making self understood (Expression)
questions.description: Expressing information content - both verbal and non-verbal

responses.title: Understood
responses.description: Expresses without difficulty

responses.title: Often understood
responses.description: Difficulty finding words or finishing thoughts but if given time, little or no prompting required

responses.title: Sometimes understood
responses.description: Ability is limited to making concrete requests

questions.title: Ability to understand others (comprehension)
questions.description: Understanding verbal information content

responses.title: Understands
responses.description: Clear comprehension

responses.title: Usually understands
responses.description: Misses some part / intent of message but comprehends most conversation

responses.title: Often understands
responses.description: Misses some part / intent of message but with repetition or explanation can often comprehend conversation

responses.title: Sometimes understands
responses.description: Responds adequately to simple, direct communication only

questions.title: Hearing
questions.description: Ability to hear (with hearing applicance normally used)

responses.title: Adequate
responses.description: No difficulty in normal conversation, listening to TV

responses.title: Minimal difficulty
responses.description: Difficulty in some environments (e.g. when person speaks softly)

responses.title: Moderate difficulty
responses.description: Problem hearing normal conversation, requires quiet setting to hear well

responses.title: Severe difficulty
responses.description: Difficulty in all situations

questions.title: Vision
questions.description: Ability to see in adequate light

responses.title: Adequate
responses.description: Sees fine detail, including regular print in newspaper / books

responses.title: Minimal difficulty
responses.description: Sees large print, but not regular print in newspapers / books

responses.title: Moderate difficulty
responses.description: Limited visionM not able to see newspaper headlines, but can identify objects

responses.title: Severe difficulty
responses.description: Object identification in question, but eyes appear to follow objects; sees only light, colors, shapes
